items.title: Iranian cleric rails against U.S., calls for death penalty for demonstrators, as protests appear to ebb
items.summary_auto: Iran's deadly crackdown appears to have broadly quelled protests for now, according to a rights group and residents, as state media reported more arrests on Friday in the shadow of U.S. threats to intervene if the killing continues.

items.title: Canada's Mboko defeats Australia's Birrell for spot in Adelaide International final
items.summary_auto: Canada's Victoria Mboko is onto the Adelaide International women's tennis final. The 19-year-old from Toronto defeated Australia's Kimberly Birrell 6-2, 6-1 in the semifinals on Friday to advance.

items.title: Federal Court of Appeal to rule on Liberals' use of Emergencies Act to clear convoy protests
items.summary_auto: The Federal Court of Appeal is expected to give its decision Friday morning on whether the Liberal government unlawfully invoked the Emergencies Act to clear the convoy protests that gridlocked the capital and border points in 2022.

items.title: RCMP applicants endured 'improper and invasive' medical exams for years, lawsuit alleges
items.summary_auto: One thousand RCMP employees, past and present, allege as part of a class-action lawsuit headed to Federal Court this month, that they were subjected to "improper and invasive" breast, genital and rectal exams during mandatory medical screening, CBC News has learned.

items.title: Legault's resignation triggers shakeup. What can we expect from the Parti Québécois?
items.summary_auto: The Parti Québécois, which has been leading in the polls for the better part of two years, is in a favourable position as it prepares for the vote next fall. Party leader Paul St-Pierre Plamondon is set to hold a news conference this morning.

items.title: Are you overpaying for a lab-grown diamond?
items.summary_auto: Marketed as an alternative to mined diamonds, lab-grown stones are growing in popularity among engaged couples, taking some of the shine from mined or “natural” diamonds, which have traditionally dominated the market.

items.title: Former South Korea leader handed 5-year jail term for charges related to martial law
items.summary_auto: The Seoul Central District Court found the ex-president guilty of mobilizing the presidential security service to block authorities from executing an arrest warrant that had been legally issued by a court to investigate him ​for his martial law declaration.

items.title: Kyle Tucker to sign with L.A. Dodgers in $240 million US, 4-year deal: AP
items.summary_auto: Kyle Tucker has agreed to a $240-million US, four-year contract with the Los Angeles Dodgers, according to a person familiar with the deal, bolstering the franchise's chance for a third consecutive World Series championship.

items.title: Long lineups in central Alberta to sign petition for province to leave Canada
items.summary_auto: Large crowds of people lined up around the block outside a pair of packed community halls in central Alberta on Wednesday night, to attend town meetings focused on the idea of the province seeking independence from Canada.

items.title: Tribunal fines B.C. ostrich farm $10K for failing to report avian influenza symptoms
items.summary_auto: The Canada Agricultural Review Tribunal issued the fine to the farm's owners in Edgewood, B.C., for failing to report symptoms of sickness in their birds in December 2024.

items.title: New measles uptick 'alarming,' Alberta doctor warns
items.summary_auto: Alberta's measles case counts have jumped after several quieter months, sparking concerns about the province’s ability to quash the outbreak.

items.title: Quebec rolling out new screening tools to help detect cervical cancer earlier
items.summary_auto: The province is moving away from the traditional Pap test in favour of a more accurate test for human papillomavirus (HPV). It can pick up abnormalities sooner because it looks for the presence of high-risk HPV infections which cause the majority of cervical cancer cases.

items.title: Harry Styles announces new album, Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally
items.summary_auto: Harry Styles has announced that his long-awaited, fourth studio album will arrive this spring. It follows the 2022, critically  acclaimed synth pop record Harry's House.

items.title: 17-year-old charged with manslaughter in overdose death of 16-year-old girl in Prince George, B.C.
items.summary_auto: Police say the young victim was found unresponsive at a home in Prince George, B.C., in 2024 and later died in hospital.

items.title: B.C. and feds sign lumber understanding with China, as province looks beyond U.S.
items.summary_auto: The five-year agreement, which is not legally binding, also involves the federal Department of Natural Resources. The deal calls for exchanges and joint research on modern wood construction.

items.title: Disbarred Calgary lawyer forged court documents, keeping client from child, judge hears in guilty plea
items.summary_auto: A Calgary lawyer who falsified court documents and repeatedly lied to a client, causing the man to miss out on parenting time with his youngest child, pleaded guilty to forgery on Thursday.

items.title: Woman at centre of Chinese family's immigration nightmare now facing charge in Sask.
